newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK forwarders seek to boost China links.
newsitem.headline: HK forwarders seek to boost China links.

text.p: The Hong Kong Association of Freight Forwarding Agents Ltd (HAFFA) is expanding links with its counterparts in China, its newly elected secretary Thomas Tang told Reuters.
HAFFA -- which has 261 members -- is planning to send a delegation to the Chinese capital, Beijing, to strengthen relationships with the Chinese air cargo community, he said in an interview.

"After the handover next month we are going to have to work very closely with them in the future. There is much to learn on both sides. We can help them develop their business connections and they can help us do business in China," Tang said.
HAFFA representatives last visited officials in Beijing two years ago, and they are expected to fly to the Chinese capital in September or October.

In another development to increase cross border relationships, officials from Shenzhen airport have visited Hong Kong recently to encourage HAFFA members to fly air cargo from there instead of the territory's Kai Tak airport. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+5017
